definitions.definition: a place where children go to be educated:
the period of your life during which you go to school, or the teaching and learning activities which happen at school:
examples: Most children start/begin school at the age of five.

definitions.definition: the time during the day when children are studying in school:
all the children and teachers at a school:
examples: The whole school is/are delighted about Joel's success in the championships.

definitions.definition: a part of a college or university specializing in a particular subject or group of subjects:
examples: the School of Oriental and African Studies

definitions.definition: a place where people can study a particular subject either some of the time or all of the time:
a college or university or the time that a student spends there:
examples: We first met in graduate school (= while doing a second or third university degree).

definitions.definition: to train a person or animal to do something:
examples: It takes a lot of patience to school a dog/horse.
Her children are well schooled in correct behaviour.
